stanza.line: I grant thou wert not married to my musemuse
And therefore mayst without attaint oerlookoerlook
The dedicated words which writers useuse
Of their fair subject blessing every bookbook
Thou art as fair in knowledge as in huehue
Finding thy worth a limit past my praisepraise
And therefore art enforced to seek anewanew
Some fresher stamp of the time-bettering daysdays
And do so love yet when they have deviseddevised
What strained touches rhetoric can lendlend
Thou truly fair wert truly sympathizedsympathized
In true plain words by thy true-telling friendfriend
And their gross painting might be better usedused
Where cheeks need blood in thee it is abusedabused
